verifyEmail.title: Check your inbox

pixel.title: Source Pixel
pixel.description: This custom snippet of code that will allow you to track user activity across your website.

card.title: Sign up forms
card.description: URLs of all the pages on your website that contain forms.

connectGoogleAdds.title: Connect Google Ads
connectGoogleAdds.description: Keep track of your ads by connecting Google Ads with your website.
connectGoogleAdds.description1: It is important that you follow the order of this instructions without skipping any step.

steps.1: Log in to your Google Ads account
steps.2: and in the Allowed domains, add this domain. Save to finish!
steps.3: and in the allowed emails list, add this email:
steps.4: Provide us with your Google Ads Customer ID

connectGoogleAdds.tooltip: You can find you customer ID on the top right corner of the window next to the profile picture. It is a series of numbers with this format: 123-456-7890

error.hubspotAuthFailed: Hubspot failed to get authorization URL
error.hubspotCallbackNotAllowed: Hubspot callback URL provided is not allowed
error.salesforceCallbackUrlNotAllowed: Salesforce callback URL provided is not allowed
error.salesforceQueryFailed: Salesforce API failed to query data
error.metaAuthFailed: Meta Ads failed to get authorization URL
error.metaCallbackNotAllowed: Meta Ads callback URL provided is not allowed
error.googleAuthFailed: Google Ads failed to get authorization URL
error.googleCallbackNotAllowed: Google Ads callback URL provided is not allowed

selectSource.title: Select your Source
selectSource.description: Choose the Source you want to use when defining the Customer Funnel.

crmList.label: For B2B Software Companies that use a CRM to manage their lead funnel.
crmList.connect: Please connect this CRM before setting up the customer funnel.
crmList.tooltip: Itâ€™s not possible to connect more than 1 CRM. If you have any questions please contact our Support Team.

selectSource.selfServeLabel: For Self-serve SaaS Companies or eCommerce Companies that don't use a CRM.
selectSource.cantEditFunnels: You can not edit this funnel settings here on Source. To edit this funnel, you need to login to your {crm} account.

step1.title: First, tell us a bit about yourself
step1.name: What's your name?

step2.companySize: What is the size of your company?

step3.title: Ok {name}, let's get that good good data!
step3.text: First, let's setup your data connections. Don't worry if it gets too technical, we'll send the task to someone in your organization to complete.

dashboard.title: Give your dashboard a unique name
dashboard.text: This is the name you'll see in your website and when you share reports with others.

goals.title: Add a couple goals
goals.text1: Adding key performance indicators will help to paint a full picture of your data in context.
goals.text2: You can add these at any time if you're not sure yet.

defineFunnel.title: Ready to define your customer funnel?
defineFunnel.text1: Everyone measures their funnel in different ways â€” so what does your funnel look like? Add at least one event that defines each phase of the funnel: top, middle and bottom.
defineFunnel.text2: As always, you can skip them and add them to your dashboard at any time if you're not sure yet.

funnels.title: Confirm your customer funnel stages
funnels.text1: Defining each stage and assigning key performance indicators will allow you to keep track of your customers throughout the funnel.
funnels.text: Defining each stage and assigning key performance indicators will allow you to keep track of your customers throughout the funnel. You can change and adjust these later, so just do your best.

stages.title: How do you define {name}?
stages.description: Folks often start with something that denotes interest - like pricing page views.

form.disabledTooltip: You can set up only one of these two types of events.

budgetTracker.title: Budget Tracker
budgetTracker.description: Track your spend against a budget
budgetTracker.recurringMonthly: {budget}, refreshes on the 1st of each month

websiteActivity.title: Website Activity
websiteActivity.description: {number, plural, =0 {Track any defined action on your site} =1 {1 event tracked} other {# events tracked}}

step1.title: Ok {name}, let's get that good good data!
step1.description: First, let's setup your data connections. Don't worry if it gets too technical, we'll send the task to someone in your organization to complete.

step2.title: Name your website
step2.description: This will be private for now but you'll be able to invite collaborators and share reports from this space.

dropzone.reject: File must be an image less than 5mb
dropzone.description: Drag and drop your image here to upload. We can accept only image files that are less than 5mb in size.
dropzone.descriptionReplace: Drag and drop other image to replace this one if you to change it. We can accept only image files that are less than 5mb in size.

step3.title: Select any connection to add data to Source
step3.description: Just add platforms that you have existing accounts with for now. You'll be able to add new ones later.
step3.requestConnectionTitle: Would you like to add something to this?
step3.errorMessage: There is an error submitting the request

step4.title: Identify your sign up forms
step4.description: Please provide the URLs for the website pages that contain a sign up form that you would like to track. This information will help us customize your tracking pixel as a next step.
step4.tooltipLabel: Query selectors are tools that help you find and use specific elements on a webpage.

step5.title: Plug in your website
step5.description: Add the URL of your website. Don't worry about any of the formatting, we'll take care of that.

step6.title: Connect your website â€” it's easy, we promise.
step6.description: We've created a custom snippet of code that will allow you to track user activity across your website.
step6.needHelpResponse: Send the website tracking instructions to someone on your team with more technical experience if needed. The installation should take no more than a few minutes of their time.

selfHosted.1: Log in to your websites admin panel
selfHosted.2: Access the template or theme editor and open 'header.php' or {htmlTag}
selfHosted.3: Insert this code snippet before < /head> in your custom snippet. Save to finish!
selfHosted.5: Weâ€™ll be able to test this later.

step7.title: You're all set.
step7.description: Now, let's get into the good stuff.
step7.imageAtl: Green Hand with a smiley face

new.title: Create your first dashboard
new.text: You'll be able to adjust order and contents a little later.

executive.title: Executive
executive.description: Your favorite set of high-level essential metrics.
executive.tooltip: You already have an executive dashboard. To create a new one, please delete the existing dashboard first.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Track the impact of your paid traffic channels against your KPIs.

campaign.title: Campaign
campaign.description: Metrics to monitor and dissect what's driving your campaigns.

organic.title: Organic
organic.description: Track the impact of your organic traffic channels against your KPIs.

marketing.title: Take the pain out of marketing data.
marketing.description: From the jump, Source let's you spend more time doing what you were hired to do and less time in the data dumps.

presetDashboard.title: Get up and running fast with preset dashboards.
presetDashboard.description: Customize your dashboards in minutes, not hours with ready-made dashboards made by marketers, for marketers.

itHassle.title: Track your website without the IT hassle.
itHassle.description: Remember that little snippet your dropped into your website? That's all you'll need to track visitors across your site.

confirmConnection.description: You're about to integrate {connection} with your existing setup.
confirmConnection.description2: This action will replace your current Customer Funnel with a new one from {connection}.
confirmConnection.importantDescription: This change is irreversible, and your existing funnel will be permanently deleted

shareALink.title: Share link
shareALink.defaultMessage:
Hey! We are installing a tracking conversion code snippet on our website to improve our marketing data and I need your help installing. Here are the easy to follow instructions to setup the Source tracking code on our site: 
1. Log in to your website's admin panel 
2. Access the template or theme editor and open 'header.php' or similar 
3. Insert this code snippet before {htmlTag} in your custom snippet. Save to finish! 
4. Test your website
